DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Recurrent Or Progressive Disease Status Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether the recurrent or progressive disease was symptomatic.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Recurrent Or Progressive Disease Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._The return of a disease after a period of remission._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Having to do with symptoms, which are signs of a condition or disease._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

PermissibleValues.value: Yes, Identified due to a change in symptoms
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Identification Due To Symptom Change Yes

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Identification Due To Symptom Change Yes
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The procedure of having an identity established.: Caused by or resulting from.: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The procedure of having an identity established.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
The affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.value: No, Identified at regular follow-up interval

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The procedure of having an identity established.: Customary, usual, or at fixed intervals; conforming to a standard or pattern.: The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.: The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The procedure of having an identity established.
Customary, usual, or at fixed intervals; conforming to a standard or pattern.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.
The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Having to do with symptoms, which are signs of a condition or disease.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: Exhibiting the symptoms of a particular disease.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
